bug.author: ScottTodd
bug.summary: Android check tests for dylib-llvm-aot are failing
bug.description:
Blocking <denchmark-link:https://github.com/google/iree/pull/3928>#3928</denchmark-link>
Sample buildkite run: <denchmark-link:https://buildkite.com/iree/iree-android-arm64-v8a/builds/3249>https://buildkite.com/iree/iree-android-arm64-v8a/builds/3249</denchmark-link>
Summary: <denchmark-code>The following tests FAILED: -- Â | 34 - iree/modules/check/test/check_dylib-llvm-aot_dylib_success.mlir_on_android_device (Failed) Â | 40 - iree/test/e2e/llvm_specific/check_llvm-aot-conv_img2col_conv.mlir_on_android_device (Failed) Â | 41 - iree/test/e2e/llvm_specific/check_llvm-aot-exponential_fast_exponential.mlir_on_android_device (Failed) Â | 50 - iree/test/e2e/structural/check_dylib-llvm-aot_dylib_slice_add.mlir_on_android_device (Failed) Â | 153 - iree/test/e2e/xla_ops/check_dylib-llvm-aot_dylib_abs.mlir_on_android_device (Failed) Â | 154 - iree/test/e2e/xla_ops/check_dylib-llvm-aot_dylib_add.mlir_on_android_device (Failed) ... </denchmark-code>
Specific error message: <denchmark-code>+ adb shell 'cd /data/local/tmp && LD_LIBRARY_PATH=/data/local/tmp iree/test/e2e/xla_ops/check_dylib-llvm-aot_dylib_while.mlir/iree-check-module --driver=dylib iree/test/e2e/xla_ops/check_dylib-llvm-aot_dylib_while.mlir/check_dylib-llvm-aot_dylib_while.mlir_module.module' -- Â | I ../iree/tools/utils/vm_util.cc:227] Creating driver and device for 'dylib'... Â | [==========] Running 1 test from 1 test suite. Â | [----------] Global test environment set-up. Â | [----------] 1 test from module Â | [ RUN ] module.while Â | ../iree/modules/check/iree-check-module-main.cc:65: Failure Â | Value of: iree_vm_context_create_with_modules( instance_, modules_.data(), modules_.size(), iree_allocator_system(), &context_) Â | Expected: is OK Â | Actual: 0x7258e1120e (of type void*), which is not OK Â | [ FAILED ] module.while, where GetParam() = 2 (1 ms) Â | [----------] 1 test from module (1 ms total) </denchmark-code>
We should be able to disable by setting IREE_LLVMAOT_DISABLE somewhere in our build/test scripts / Buildkite workflows / VM images. Fixing may require setting the appropriate Android target triple as part of <denchmark-link:https://github.com/google/iree/blob/main/build_tools/cmake/iree_check_test.cmake>https://github.com/google/iree/blob/main/build_tools/cmake/iree_check_test.cmake</denchmark-link>

comments.comment:
cc <denchmark-link:https://github.com/GMNGeoffrey>@GMNGeoffrey</denchmark-link> <denchmark-link:https://github.com/asaadaldien>@asaadaldien</denchmark-link> <denchmark-link:https://github.com/hanhanW>@hanhanW</denchmark-link>
If someone more familiar with our Android test infra and cross compilation on Linux could help with a workaround (or investigating the root cause), that would be appreciated. You can send pull requests based off of the branch.

I think we need to set android target triple here some where here for to use <denchmark-link:https://github.com/google/iree/blob/main/build_tools/cmake/iree_check_test.cmake#L98>https://github.com/google/iree/blob/main/build_tools/cmake/iree_check_test.cmake#L98</denchmark-link>
I will look into that, These tests are also failing locally right ?
I pushed a commit that made tests passes locally on scotttodd-llvmaot-config branch.

I pushed a commit that made tests passes locally on scotttodd-llvmaot-config branch.
Thanks! That looks about right to me, but it doesn't quite work on our Buildkite CI: <denchmark-link:https://buildkite.com/iree/iree-android-arm64-v8a/builds/3262#d95a9a46-5b89-4298-993b-96f66340c9f7>https://buildkite.com/iree/iree-android-arm64-v8a/builds/3262#d95a9a46-5b89-4298-993b-96f66340c9f7</denchmark-link>
<denchmark-code>[665/843] Generating check_dylib-llvm-aot_dylib_success.mlir_module.module
FAILED: iree/modules/check/test/check_dylib-llvm-aot_dylib_success.mlir_module.module
cd /usr/src/github/iree/build/iree/modules/check/test && /usr/src/github/iree/build/host/bin/iree-translate -iree-mlir-to-vm-bytecode-module --iree-hal-target-backends=dylib-llvm-aot --iree-llvm-target-triple=aarch64-none-linux-android30 /usr/src/github/iree/iree/modules/check/test/success.mlir -o check_dylib-llvm-aot_dylib_success.mlir_module.module
/usr/bin/ld: unrecognized -a option `tic-libstdc++'
Linking failed; command line returned exit code 256:
/usr/bin/ld -shared -o /tmp/success_linked_llvm_aot-e81837.so -static-libstdc++ /tmp/success_linked_llvm_aot-e81837.obj
/usr/src/github/iree/iree/modules/check/test/success.mlir:0:0: error: failed to link executable and generate target dylib using linker toolchain /usr/bin/ld
/usr/src/github/iree/iree/modules/check/test/success.mlir:0:0: error: failed to serialize op to target backend dylib* </denchmark-code>
ðŸ¤”

Ah yes. we need to push docker images with no IREE_LLVMAOT_LINKER_PATH otherwise it overrides toolchain path On Mon, Dec 7, 2020 at 8:03 AM Scott Todd ***@***.***> wrote: I pushed a commit that made tests passes locally on scotttodd-llvmaot-config branch.
Thanks! That looks about right to me, but it doesn't quite work on our Buildkite CI:

Probably need to update this as well:
iree/build_tools/mako/compile_android_modules.sh
Line 53 in 3632da3
export IREE_LLVMAOT_LINKER_PATH="${ANDROID_NDK?}/toolchains/llvm/prebuilt/linux-x86_64/bin/aarch64-linux-android29-clang++ -static-libstdc++ -O3"

Probably need to update this as well:
iree/build_tools/mako/compile_android_modules.sh
Line 53 in 3632da3
export IREE_LLVMAOT_LINKER_PATH="${ANDROID_NDK?}/toolchains/llvm/prebuilt/linux-x86_64/bin/aarch64-linux-android29-clang++ -static-libstdc++ -O3"
This is for mako testing, so it won't fix the error.
